alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 26 at 11:26AM EDT until March 27 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches through tonight. The highest accumulations will be on the western facing slopes. Winds will gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates have exceeded 1 inch per hour in a few places in western Pendleton. Expect snow rates to continue like this, plus reduced visibility in these areas.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
